chapter.title: About Opics Portal
chapter.para: This chapter introduces the Misys Opics Portal and explains its significance to its customers.

Opics Portal offers a key delivery channel for corporate customers to quickly and easily manage their global trading activities online. This delivery channel provides the opportunity to take advantage of an extensive worldwide network of international branches and correspondent banks to speed the handling of their trade transactions around the globe.

Using a comprehensive web-based interface, the customers can process and review their transactions. They can submit business requests and also browse through analysis or information pertaining to their financial transactions.

section.title: Managing Customer Static Data
section.para: Opics Plus customers are defined as global static data, that is, all customers are available to trade with all legal entities which can be banks or branches.
The portal also defines customer but requires mapping of customers to the legal entities. Each mapping in the portal requires a reference code to be created that can be fed to the back-end system.

The customers are not entered automatically into the portal. Communication between Opics Plus and Opics Portal require a dual key method of entry for a manual setup. Alternatively, it is also entered using two different interfaces from the bankâ€™s ERM/CRM system.

section.title: End User-Management
section.para: Opics Portal users are designated with one or more customers associated with one or more banks or branches. Using the portal, a single end user can initiate transactions on behalf of multiple customers and banks or branches.

section.title: Global Product List
section.para: Opics Portal manages the list of products available for trade. Currently, it provides the following modules of Opics Plus:

listitem.para: That includes Spot, Forward, Swap, Delivery Option, Order, Split, Extend, Uptake, and Option Takedown

section.para: The portal also allows you to select and restrict the products available for trading.

section.title: Incomplete Forms & Error Handling
section.para: If the user submits an incomplete form in the portal, the transaction request is not processed and the missing data is highlighted by an indicator or an error message.
When a transaction is submitted, the user must provide all required fields in the corresponding form. On successfully processing, a message is displayed for confirmation.
